pros: a very caring, multicultural and supportive research institute with many opportunities

review_title: Disappointed by an org that has lost sight of its identity and appreciation of its staff by focusing too much on growth
pros: Great building in Newtown. Organisation stands for a good cause.
cons: No staff promotion, below market pay, lack of transparency, HR don't deal with issues raised appropriately. Focus on hiring external talent rather than developing their own. Lack of innovation brought in by senior staff.

review_title: overall great work environment and career suppor
pros: great working environment and provisions for WFH
cons: there are no cons for this job.

pros: Nice office, 'feel good' work with international collaboration
cons:
Salary package (base+superannuation):
Research Assistant $65,000
Senior Research Assistant $69,000
Research Associate $73,000
Research Fellow $94,000
Research Program Manager $125,000

Difficult to get permanent position. Mostly 1 year or 2 years contract and will be renewed depending on funding.

review_title: Amazing organisation with a strong purpose and dedicated to achieving this
job_title: Head Of Human Resources in Sydney
pros: Great team of people doing amazing work
cons: None, its a great place to work.

pros:
Recognition system if you're "in favour".
Ability to move into other departments.
Good affiliations with overseas universities.
Flexibility to work from home.
cons:
Temporary workplace, cramped, will be changed later this year.
Department heads taking credit for work performed or ideas that come from the department.

review_title: Flexible, but little opportunity for development
pros:
Flexible working hours, which is great - possibility to work from home.
Good salary benefits - smart salary packaging.
Friendly co workers, easy to get along with most.
Great location (CBD).
cons:
No or little opportunities for development.
No mentoring program for new/young staff.
Rare promotions outside of management staff.
Moving to Newtown in December 2016.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Sydney
pros:
- Flexibility 
 - Autonomous culture; ability to follow passions to fuel organisation growth
 - Work with really smart & engaged people
 - Global HQ in Australia; work with diverse people around the world
 - Tax free component of salary as a Not For Profit in Australia

Friendly team, well-organised admin functions
Nice coffee machines, weekly morning tea
Great people to work with
